intro: Leucanthemum astericodes, commonly known as the starry leucanthemum, is a perennial flowering plant native to Europe and parts of Asia. It belongs to the Asteraceae family, which is characterized by its composite flower heads composed of ray and disk florets. The plant typically grows to a height of 30–60 cm, featuring hairy stems and basal leaves that are often heart-shaped. Its flowers are showy, with white ray florets surrounding a central cluster of yellow disk florets, blooming from late spring to early autumn. It prefers well-drained soil and full to partial sunlight, making it a popular choice for garden landscapes.
